body:
**Environment**:
* OS: centos7.4
* Kernel :4.17
* Rook version :rook/ceph:v0.7.0-240.gc568dd6
* Kubernetes version:1.9.1
* Kubernetes cluster type:OpenShift 3.9 (one master node and tree compute nodes)
 I just cleaned up the cluster and rm -rf /var/lib/rook. 
I tested rook/ceph:v0.7.0-240.gc568dd6 ， found that the operator did not create osd according to the cluster configuration file. the log and config file ：https://gist.github.com/aland-zhang/71f7bc4f5461a75236d6b67757a1ae4b

apiVersion: ceph.rook.io/v1alpha1
kind: Cluster
metadata:
  clusterName: ''
  creationTimestamp: '2018-06-30T02:01:49Z'
  finalizers:
    - cluster.ceph.rook.io
  generation: 0
  name: rook-ceph
  namespace: rook
spec:
  dashboard:
    enabled: true
  dataDirHostPath: /var/lib/rook
  mon:
    allowMultiplePerNode: true
    count: 3
  network:
    hostNetwork: true
  serviceAccount: default
  storage:
    config:
      databaseSizeMB: '1024'
      journalSizeMB: '1024'
      storeType: bluestore
      walSizeMB: '2024'
    nodes:
      - config: null
        devices:
          - FullPath: ''
            config: null
            name: vdc
          - FullPath: ''
            config: null
            name: vdd
        name: 10.10.3.148
        resources: {}
      - config: null
        devices:
          - FullPath: ''
            config: null
            name: vdc
        name: 10.10.5.180
        resources: {}
      - config: null
        devices:
          - FullPath: ''
            config: null
            name: vdc
          - FullPath: ''
            config: null
            name: vdd
        name: 10.10.41.50
        resources: {}
    useAllDevices: false

Just looked at the cluster situation and found that the operator created three more osd,  I only have 5 hard drives on 3 nodes. but operator created 8 osds.
osd-5 6 7 ，Not specified in the cluster configuration file, but these three osd were created，
The following is the configuration of rook-ceph-osd-5-fs-backup（Rook-ceph-osd-6-fs-backup and 7 are the same）.
Please see my cluster configuration file above and I have not set it（/var/lib/rook/osd5/bluestore-db）, but it is created automatically.
There is no new disk drive add in cluster config , but the rook-ceph-osd-prepare job is automatically up and osd is created automatically.
apiVersion: v1
data:
 bluefs: |
   1
 ceph_fsid: |
   3af30768-54fb-4338-8722-62ff7b0498d0
 fsid: |
   db08c8d7-4b02-4e2d-a3ac-0412e1c6586b
 kv_backend: |
   rocksdb
 magic: |
   ceph osd volume v026
 mkfs_done: |
   yes
 path_block.db: |
   /var/lib/rook/osd5/bluestore-db
 path_block.wal: |
   /var/lib/rook/osd5/bluestore-wal
 ready: |
   ready
 type: |
   bluestore
 whoami: |
   5
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
 creationTimestamp: '2018-07-10T06:01:13Z'
 name: rook-ceph-osd-5-fs-backup
 namespace: rook (edited)

milestone.description:
* Multiple storage backends
  * Full design
  * Refactor code base and repositories to enable
  * Consider support for Minio, potentially early support for other backends time permitting
* Switch CRDs to API Aggregation
* Run on arbitrary PVs
* Remove Rook API and CLI
* Migrate CI and release pipelines to a solution hosted by the CNCF
* Run with Least Privileged and possibly without privileged containers
* Shutdown / restart issues
* Support Kubernetes 1.7+ only
* Ceph features and improvements
  * Adding/removing disks (lifecycle issues, failures, 1 OSD per pod, etc.)
  * Placement group balancer support (ceph-mgr module)
  * Mon reliability (restarts, failing over too fast, ip changes, etc.)
  * Mimic support

title: Operator restart unexpectedly created new osds in default directory
